    1. loadBean(T)

Class PropertiesReader<T>

java.lang.Object
in.testautomationstudio.commons.reader.PropertiesReader<T>
Type Parameters:
T - type of the configuration bean handled by this reader
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationReader<T>
public class PropertiesReader<T> extends Object implements ConfigurationReader<T>
Reflection-based implementation of ConfigurationReader that binds property values from a classpath resource (properties file) into a target bean's fields.

Behavior overview:

  • Determine the properties file to load from either the reader's constructor (if provided) or from the target bean's Configuration.filePath() annotation when present.
  • Interpolate placeholders in the chosen file path using PlaceholderResolver.resolvePlaceholders(String) (supporting environment variables or other placeholders as implemented by that utility).
  • Load the properties file from the runtime classpath using the ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream(String) mechanism. If the resource is missing a FileNotFoundException is thrown.
  • For each non-static, non-final declared field on the bean annotated with PropertyKey, determine the property key and default value from the annotation, pick an appropriate parser and assign the converted value to the field.

Parsing and conversion rules

  • The reader maintains a small built-in map of parsers for common types (int, Integer, float, Float, double, Double, boolean, Boolean). These are used automatically when the field's type matches.
  • If the PropertyKey.parser() element declares a custom PropertyValueParser (one other than DefaultPropertyValueParser), the reader will instantiate it via a no-argument constructor and use it to parse the property value.
  • If no parser is specified and the field is an enum, the reader will resolve the enum constant using Enum.valueOf(Class, String).
  • Otherwise the raw string value is assigned directly (suitable for String fields or for downstream conversion).
  • If the resolved property value is null or blank (as defined by StringUtils.isBlank(CharSequence)), the reader will not modify the field (the existing value remains). Note: the annotation's defaultValue is supplied to Properties.getProperty(String, String) which means a non-empty default will be used when the property is absent.

Errors and exceptions

  • Missing property resource: FileNotFoundException wrapped in a RuntimeException is thrown.
  • Failure to instantiate a custom parser: the reader throws a RuntimeException with details about the parser class and cause.
  • Reflection errors when writing fields are wrapped in a RuntimeException.

Examples


 // Example 1: use the annotation on the config class
 @Configuration(filePath = "qa-configurations.properties")
 public class QAConfig {
     @PropertyKey(key = "service.url", defaultValue = "http://localhost:8080")
     private String serviceUrl;
 }

 QAConfig cfg = new QAConfig();
 new PropertiesReader<QAConfig>().loadBean(cfg);
 // cfg.serviceUrl now contains either the value from the properties file
 // or the annotation default if the key was not present.

 // Example 2: pass a file path directly to the reader (overrides annotation)
 PropertiesReader<QAConfig> reader = new PropertiesReader<>("test-configurations.properties");
 reader.loadBean(cfg);

 // Example 3: custom parser
 public class CommaSeparatedListParser implements PropertyValueParser<List<String>> {
     @Override
     public List<String> parse(String value) {
         if (value == null || value.isEmpty()) return Collections.emptyList();
         return Arrays.stream(value.split(","))
                      .map(String::trim)
                      .collect(Collectors.toList());
     }
 }

 public class ListConfig {
     @PropertyKey(key = "items", parser = CommaSeparatedListParser.class)
     private List<String> items;
 }

 ListConfig listCfg = new ListConfig();
 new PropertiesReader<ListConfig>().loadBean(listCfg);

Extension points

  • Add more built-in parsers to the PARSERS map if you need automatic handling for additional primitive/wrapper types.
  • Adjust blank/empty handling policies (for example, to treat empty values as explicit empty strings rather than "missing").
  • Provide alternative resource loading strategies (file system, remote config service) by replacing the resource resolution logic or by subclassing and overriding loadBean(Object).

  • Constructor Details

    • PropertiesReader

      public PropertiesReader()
      Create an empty reader that will attempt to discover the properties file via the Configuration annotation on the target bean's class.

    • PropertiesReader

      public PropertiesReader(String filePath)
      Create a reader that uses the supplied filePath when loading properties. This path is treated as a classpath resource and will be resolved via the active ClassLoader.
      Parameters:
      filePath - path to the properties resource (relative to the classpath)

  • Method Details

    • loadBean

      public void loadBean(T bean)
      Populate the provided bean by reading property values from the configured properties file and assigning them to fields annotated with PropertyKey.

      Algorithm summary:

      1. If the reader was constructed without a file path, try to obtain one from the target class's Configuration annotation. (If both are absent, PlaceholderResolver will be invoked on a null/empty path which may result in an error.)
      2. Resolve placeholders in the file path via PlaceholderResolver.resolvePlaceholders(String).
      3. Load the resolved resource from the classpath. A missing resource results in a FileNotFoundException wrapped by a RuntimeException.
      4. Iterate declared instance fields on the target bean; for fields annotated with PropertyKey, obtain the property value (or the annotation's default) and delegate to setFieldValue(java.lang.reflect.Field, T, java.lang.Object, in.testautomationstudio.commons.parser.PropertyValueParser<?>) for conversion and assignment.
      Specified by:
      loadBean in interface ConfigurationReader<T>
      Parameters:
      bean - non-null instance whose annotated fields are to be populated
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - wrapping IO or reflection failures
